synsets.definition: Active opposition or hostility; deep-seated ill will toward others expressed through confrontational behavior
Sanskrit/Hindi concept of enmity and hatred; systematic opposition rooted in karmic antagonism and deep psychological aversion
Japanese notion of adversarial spirit; hostile disposition characterized by viewing others as enemies or obstacles to overcome
Arabic concept of deep enmity and vengeful hostility; enduring grudge that motivates retaliatory behavior
African philosophical concept describing behavior that violates communal harmony; aggressive individualism that destroys social bonds
Native American concept of destructive antisocial force; insatiable selfishness that consumes community bonds and turns person against tribe
Latin American concept of toxic masculine aggression; hostile dominance behavior rooted in cultural patterns of male supremacy
Korean notion of deep-rooted hostility and antagonism; enduring enmity often connected to family or clan conflicts across generations
